title: Print, "Camping in the Adirondacks", November 7, 1874
medium: Wood engraving on off-white wove paper
signed:
Signed on tree stump with initials, lower left: W H
Signed on block, lower right: Lagarde SC
inscribed: Caption: CAMPING OUT IN THE ADIRONDACK MOUNTAINS.-(DRAWN BY WINSLOW HOMER.)
creditline: Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.
description: Two men, Rufus Wallace and unknown companion, sit before a bark lean-to on the Mink Pond shore in front of smudge fire to keep the insects away.  Fishing paraphernalia including a canoe and a string of three fish can be found in the right middle ground, while a dog can be seen in the left middle ground.  Information from: Ferber, Linda S., Barbara Dayer Gallati and Marilyn S. Kushner, Winslow Homer: Illustrating America (New York, NY: George Braziller in association with Brooklyn Museum of Art, 2000), p. 131.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Camping in the Adirondacks", November 7, 1874.
November 7, 1874. Wood engraving on off-white wove paper. Gift of John Goldsmith Phillips, Jr.. 1947-4-24.
